posts.post_content: Please continue this thread by including any t206 cards you are willing to sell/trade. Looking for HOF's, SL's, Rare backs, unique miscuts, etc.

Hello Wazoo,

I'm not sure you will get a bunch of responses but what the heck I will play.

Here is an SGC 30 Shag SGC 30 "Old Mill" back.  It's a little bit over-graded in my book, probably closer to an SGC 20 but either way a respectable lower grade Shag card  which displays no obvious creases, just corner wear.  My sale price is.............................SALE PENDING..... (delivered).

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=68365&d=1341788044[/IMG][IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=68366&d=1341788060[/IMG]


T206 Marquard PSA 2..........$75 (delivered)

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=68367&d=1341788071[/IMG][IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=68368&d=1341788080[/IMG]

Lovely Day...

Here's a couple big top bordered (funky cut) T206's with corners you could literally shave with. You can have the pair for $150 bucks delivered.

[IMG]http://i9.photobucket.com/albums/a95/andreatny/mccormickfront.jpg[/IMG] [IMG]http://i9.photobucket.com/albums/a95/andreatny/mccormickback.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i9.photobucket.com/albums/a95/andreatny/livingstonefront.jpg[/IMG] [IMG]http://i9.photobucket.com/albums/a95/andreatny/livingstonback.jpg[/IMG]

I really like that Shag card, it's a much harder SL'er to obtain. 

For those two commons, why did they only grade average? They have very sharp corners and are not too off center? Thank you.

[quote name="wazoo" post=1012007]

For those two commons, why did they only grade average? They have very sharp corners and are not too off center? Thank you.[/QUOTE]

Just two more examples of what's wrong with TPG, that's all. McCormick has some light chipping on the left white border. Livingstone, your guess is as good as mine??
